subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test this class ?
msgSnippet: ... In that case, I would have suggested you test it from the command line, by preparing text files with input and using the Gold Master technique (Google
messageBody:
rubbinio wrote:
>
> Unfortunatelly I can not change the code as this was an Assignemnt in
> a Quality Assurance course and the trick was to find a way to test it
> as it is.

In that case, I would have suggested you test it from the command line,
by preparing text files with input and using the Gold Master technique
(Google keywords Keith Stobie test checking patterns) to check the
output, if at all possible.

Then you could just pipe the input using "<":

java ... Input < testcase1.txt

I don't recall whether there was an easy way to check the output, except
to write a little program that uses Input and prints out the answer.
Then a quick "diff" would tell you whether the actual output matches
what you expected.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
